It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in cloud forests where it relies on high humidity and indirect light. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ottonia pickelii is considered a conservation concern.
